channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: Pentagon explains odd transfer of 175 million IP addresses to obscure company
item.description: Something weird happened minutes before Trump left—US says it was security research.

item.title: Bad infrastructure and not being male among reasons people give up EVs
item.description: About 20 percent of Californian EV adopters gave up plug-ins, study finds.

item.title: New versions of macOS, watchOS, and tvOS hit supported devices today
item.description: macOS gets improved iPhone/iPad app experiences, AirTag support, and more.

item.title: It took Facebook two months to realize “Stop the Steal” might turn violent
item.description: Social media giant was apparently unprepared for “authentic” calls for violence.

item.title: Believe the hype: The Hyundai Veloster N is a darn good hot hatch
item.description: Tired of Europe getting great hatches we don’t? Now the tables have turned.

item.title: Africa’s first Iron Age culture had a sweet tooth
item.description: The results offer some of the oldest physical evidence of honey in people’s diets.

item.title: Roku warns customers: “Google may remove your access to YouTube TV” [Updated]
item.description: Roku says Google wants changes to Roku search. Google calls the claims “baseless.”

item.title: No, this strange Twitter account isn’t teasing a new Metal Gear Solid [Updated]
item.description: The strange story of @TheTomOlsen, “Maintenance Technician at the Big Shell.”

item.title: China’s state rocket company unveils rendering of a Starship look-alike
item.description: The Asian country has tracked SpaceX from the beginning.

item.title: Review: The Falcon and the Winter Soldier aims high but falls a bit short
item.description: It tries to do too many things at once, and thus doesn’t do them as well as it could.

item.title: Children of Chernobyl cleanup crew don’t have excess mutations
item.description: A deep look into the genetic damage left by the disaster.

item.title: Why lawmakers are so interested in Apple’s and Google’s “rents”
item.description: You can’t understand the app store debate without some grasp of antitrust jargon.

item.title: Apple’s AirDrop leaks users’ PII, and there’s not much they can do about it
item.description: Apple has known of the flaw since 2019 but has yet to acknowledge or fix it.

item.title: Republicans and Democrats increasingly agree: Big Tech is too powerful
item.description: Biden chose a Big Tech critic for the FTC—GOP senators seem happy about it.

item.title: Conservative versus liberal: A knock-down, drag-out climate policy fight
item.description: Experts weigh in on Canada’s Conservative party’s proposed carbon levy.

item.title: Apple’s ransomware mess is the future of online extortion
item.description: Hackers want $50 million to not release schematics they stole from Apple supplier.

item.title: CDC, FDA lift pause of J&J vaccine after advisers vote in support of use [Updated]
item.description: CDC advisers voted 10-4 to lift J�J pause, with new warning about clots

item.title: Backdoored password manager stole data from as many as 29K enterprises
item.description: Compromised update mechanism for Passwordstate pushes malware that steals data.

item.title: New 12.9-inch iPad Pro doesn’t support the previous Magic Keyboard
item.description: The new Apple TV 4K remote won’t work for some Apple TV games, either.

item.title: AirTags orders began today, but supplies are already dwindling
item.description: The iPhone is in stock, but AirTags are backed up to June in some cases.

item.title: Today, watch us play the opening of Sony’s promising PS5 exclusive Returnal
item.description: Update: Twitch video of Housemarque’s ambitious roguelike shooter is now up as VOD.

item.title: COVID emergency shuts Japan’s Super Nintendo World one month after opening
item.description: Construction continues on US versions of Nintendo-themed park.

item.title: Supreme Court kills FTC’s “strongest tool” for getting refunds to scam victims
item.description: Unanimous ruling limits FTC power to obtain refunds; it’s up to Congress to fix it.

item.title: 4chan founder Chris Poole leaves Google
item.description: Poole was a controversial hire for Google+, and he’s out after five years.

item.title: Minnesotans furious that they have to pay for Texas’ deep-freeze problems
item.description: Natural gas prices surged across the country during Texas’ February freeze.

item.title: Apple sued for terminating account with $25,000 worth of apps and videos
item.description: Lawsuits claim people don’t truly own content they purchase on digital platforms.

item.title: Today’s best tech deals: M1 MacBook Air, PS5 controllers, and more
item.description: Dealmaster also has noise-canceling headphones, webcams, and USB-C chargers.

item.title: NASA gets what it wanted: Independent, reliable access to space
item.description: “There doesn’t seem to be any obvious limits to the reusability of the vehicle.”

item.title: A Clubhouse bug let people lurk in rooms invisibly
item.description: Moderators would be unable to mute “ghosts” hiding in and disrupting rooms.

item.title: NASA’s bold bet on Starship for the Moon may change spaceflight forever
item.description: “It is transformational to degrees no one today can understand.”

item.title: Rocket Report: Amazon bypasses New Glenn, SLS ready for Florida shipment
item.description: “It’s extremely exciting to join with our partners to deploy new capabilities.”

item.title: Graphical Linux apps are coming to Windows Subsystem for Linux
item.description: You’ll need to be on the Dev channel of an Insider build to see the new feature.

item.title: Astronauts safely launch into orbit on a used rocket [Updated]
item.description: For a few days, 2 Crew Dragons will be docked to the space station.

item.title: COVID-19 vaccinations declining even though all US adults are eligible
item.description: With 50% of adults vaccinated, health officials begin tackling vaccine skeptics.

item.title: Mortal Kombat film review: Why you should watch on HBO Max, not in theaters
item.description: Brutally brilliant battles, buried by banal banter.

item.title: This miniature version of Starry Night was made with a “laser paintbrush”
item.description: New tool creates color on metal surfaces that can be changed, erased, rewritten.

item.title: Comcast offers tantalizing hint of a future with upload speeds above 35Mbps
item.description: Lab test produces 4Gbps upload speeds but actual uploads are still 3 to 35Mbps.

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077 refunds barely dented CD Projekt Red’s bottom line [Updated]
item.description: $51.3 million in projected refund costs vs. 13.7 million Cyberpunk copies sold in 2020.

item.title: An API that can tell your EV when it’s the optimal time to charge
item.description: Energy management systems should mean cheaper EV charging for end users.

item.title: YouTube is now building its own video-transcoding chips
item.description: Google throws custom silicon at YouTube’s massive video-transcoding workload.

item.title: iOS and iPadOS 15 will feature major changes to notifications, home screen
item.description: Plus, Apple plans to make iMessage “more of a social network.”

item.title: Consumer Reports shows Tesla Autopilot works with no one in the driver’s seat
item.description: Consumer Reports argues Tesla needs a better driver-monitoring system.

item.title: John Legere got $137 million severance for completing T-Mobile/Sprint merger
item.description: Legere’s 2020 compensation was $137.2M—he worked three months, then left in April.

item.title: Secrets of the Whales explores language, social structure of giants of the deep
item.description: James Cameron produced, Sigourney Weaver narrates new documentary series.

item.title: Meet Thistle, the startup that wants to secure billions of IoT devices
item.description: Startup gets $2.5 million funding to jump-start security for connected devices.

item.title: Analyst: Nintendo says Microsoft’s xCloud streaming isn’t coming to Switch
item.description: “Nintendo [told] me directly they would not put other streaming services on Switch.”

item.title: Biden says US will halve carbon emissions by 2030
item.description: Other countries also ratcheted up their commitments at the virtual summit.

item.title: Apple to boost ads business as iPhone changes hurt Facebook
item.description: New privacy rules deal a huge blow to how the mobile advertising industry works.

item.title: Contractor that ruined 15M doses of J&J vaccine hiked price of another by 800%
item.description: FDA releases damning inspection report as lawmakers question ties to Trump admin.

item.title: Mini-PC review: The Ryzen 5 Pro 2500U-powered Minisforum UM250
item.description: Ryzen 5, 16GiB RAM, 256GB SSD, dual Ethernet, Wi-Fi 6, and more for under $500.

item.title: Garmin’s 2 new smartwatches want to make the casual athlete more advanced
item.description: The Venu 2 and 2S polish up Garmin’s smartwatch UI and introduce new tracking features for the company.
